titleStmt.title: The former booke of the musicke of M. William Damon, late one of her maiesties musitions conteining all the tunes of Dauids Psalmes, as they are ordinarily soung in the Church: most excellently by him composed into 4. parts. In which sett the tenor singeth the church tune. Published for the recreation of such as delight in musicke: by W. Sawyne Gent.
titleStmt.author: Daman, William, ca. 1540-1591.

titleStmt.title: The former booke of the musicke of M. William Damon, late one of her maiesties musitions conteining all the tunes of Dauids Psalmes, as they are ordinarily soung in the Church: most excellently by him composed into 4. parts. In which sett the tenor singeth the church tune. Published for the recreation of such as delight in musicke: by W. Sawyne Gent.
titleStmt.author: Daman, William, ca. 1540-1591.
Swayne, William.
Sternhold, Thomas, d. 1549.
Hopkins, John, d. 1570.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. Este, the assigné of W. Byrd,

notesStmt.note: Four partbooks. At head of title page, part 1: "Cantus"; part 2: "Tenor"; part 3: "Altus"; part 4: "Bassus".
Includes excerpts from the Sternhold and Hopkins version, with other non-Psalm texts.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

person.persName: T. Este, the assigné of W. Byrd
